com.communote.server.core.common.caching

Interface CacheElementProvider<K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the key to be used for caching
    T - the type of the objects that this provider provides
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AccessRestrictedCacheElementProvider<T,U>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCacheElementProvider, ApplicationConfigurationElementProvider, ChannelConfigurationCacheElementProvider, ClientConfigurationElementProvider, FollowCacheElementProvider, ImageCacheElementProvider, IpFilterCacheElementProvider, LdapServerCacheElementProvider, PluginPropertyCacheElementProvider, StandaloneClientCacheElementProvider, UserNotePropertyCacheElementProvider, UserNoteTOElementProvider

    public interface CacheElementProvider<K extends CacheKey,T extends Serializable>
    A CacheElementProvider is required when an element is requested but not yet cached. In that case the load(CacheKey) method is called and the returned element will be cached.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ETERNAL_TIME_TO_LIVE
      Constant representing eternal caching.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getContentType()
      Returns a unique string naming the content type of the elements provided by this provider (e.g.
      int getTimeToLive()
      Returns the time in seconds describing how long a provided element will be cached without expiring (when it is not replaced manually).
      T load(K key)
      Provides an element identified by the key for caching.

    • Field Detail

      • ETERNAL_TIME_TO_LIVE

        static final int ETERNAL_TIME_TO_LIVE
        Constant representing eternal caching.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getContentType

        String getContentType()
        Returns a unique string naming the content type of the elements provided by this provider (e.g. 'image' when providing image data).
        Returns:
        the string name

      • getTimeToLive

        int getTimeToLive()
        Returns the time in seconds describing how long a provided element will be cached without expiring (when it is not replaced manually). Return ETERNAL_TIME_TO_LIVE when the element should never expire.
        Returns:
        the time to live in the cache in seconds.

      • load

        T load(K key)
throws CacheElementProviderException
        Provides an element identified by the key for caching.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to identify the requested element
        Returns:
        the loaded object or null if there is no element for the key
        Throws:
        CacheElementProviderException - in case the loading failed and nothing should or can be cached
